decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize the card Survival of the Fittest in combination with aggressive creatures like Vengevine to quickly put pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to efficiently filter through the deck with cards like Brainstorm and Intuition to find key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy with countermagic like Force of Will. The deck also includes versatile creatures like Qasali Pridemage and Waterfront Bouncer to deal with various threats, while also utilizing creatures like Wild Mongrel and Basking Rootwalla to provide early aggression.

The deck revolves around using Survival of the Fittest to tutor for creatures that can combo together for a win condition or control the board. It focuses on utilizing creatures like Vengevine and Necrotic Ooze to create powerful interactions that can quickly take over the game. With cards like Phyrexian Devourer and Triskelion, the deck can quickly assemble a lethal combo while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Shriekmaw. The deck aims to control the game while setting up powerful combos to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by stifling and countering opponents' key plays, while using Standstill to slow down the game. By using cards like Trickbind, Stifle, and Spell Snare in combination with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while setting up a win condition through Phyrexian Dreadnought. The deck also utilizes Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to further control the board and maintain card advantage. Wasteland helps to disrupt opponents' mana bases while also providing some additional control.

The main concept of this Legacy Goblins deck is to flood the board with aggressive Goblin creatures using cards like Goblin Lackey and Aether Vial to cheat them into play quickly. With key cards like Goblin Warchief and Goblin Ringleader providing additional synergy and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures to quickly deal damage and win the game before the opponent can stabilize. Control elements like Wasteland and Rishadan Port help disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure on the board.

The main concept of this deck is to use Show and Tell to put powerful creatures like Emrakul and Progenitus into play quickly, overwhelming the opponent with massive threats before they can respond. The deck also includes ways to protect the combo with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, as well as card selection and manipulation through Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck aims to win the game quickly through a powerful combo while disrupting the opponent's plan with countermagic and card manipulation.

The main concept of this deck is to use various creatures and spells to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with creatures like Vengevine and use Survival of the Fittest to search for and summon powerful creatures. By utilizing cards like Basking Rootwalla and Wild Mongrel to discard creatures into the graveyard, the deck can quickly establish a strong board presence and overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. The deck also includes various counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its strategy and disrupt opponents' plans.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures like Vengevine and using Survival of the Fittest to tutor for key creatures in the deck. It also utilizes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Spell Snare to protect its creatures and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to be aggressive and proactive, overwhelming opponents with its efficient creatures and disruption spells. The use of Fauna Shaman and other creature tutors allows for flexibility and consistency in assembling the best possible board state to quickly close out the game.

A Legacy 1 vs 1 Control deck focused on using powerful creatures and disruption spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes a mix of hand disruption, removal spells, and versatile threats like Dark Confidant, Knight of the Reliquary, and Tarmogoyf. The mana base is built around efficient dual lands and Wasteland, with additional utility lands like Maze of Ith and Bojuka Bog. The deck aims to out-value opponents through resource denial and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing fast mana acceleration and card selection to cast a high number of spells in a single turn, ultimately aiming to win the game with a storm mechanic. By generating large amounts of black mana, the deck can cast powerful spells like Ad Nauseam, Infernal Tutor, and Tendrils of Agony to secure a victory. With cards like Lion's Eye Diamond, Lotus Petal, and Rite of Flame, this deck aims to create a storm count that overwhelms the opponent in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on using Survival of the Fittest to tutor for key creatures like Vengevine and Necrotic Ooze, while also controlling the opponent's board with removal spells and disruption like Thoughtseize. By utilizing cards like Fauna Shaman and Wild Mongrel to fill the graveyard, the deck can create powerful combos with cards like Phyrexian Devourer and Triskelion. The goal is to out-value and out-manipulate the opponent through a combination of creature recursion, card selection, and disruption.

The deck focuses on using Survival of the Fittest to search for and tutor key creatures like Tarmogoyf, Vengevine, and Knight of the Reliquary. It also utilizes control elements like Swords to Plowshares and Qasali Pridemage to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional utility and ways to close out the game. With a solid mana base and a mix of aggressive and defensive creatures, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 match-up.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's plays by countering their spells and using Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top card of the library. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and control while Tarmogoyf acts as a win condition. Reactive spells like Swords to Plowshares and Spell Snare help deal with threats, while Trinket Mage and Pithing Needle provide additional utility. The land base includes various fetch lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while keeping control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to maintain card advantage through cards like Dark Confidant and Sensei's Divining Top while using versatile cards like Vindicate and Knight of the Reliquary to deal with threats efficiently. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all colors, while also including utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Exhume. It includes various high-impact creatures like Platinum Emperion and Iona, Shield of Emeria to dominate the game once they hit the battlefield. The deck also features disruption in the form of Force of Will and Pithing Needle to protect its combo pieces. Additionally, Goblin Welder provides versatility by swapping artifacts in and out of the graveyard to suit the situation.

The deck focuses on using a combination of disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand and the board. It also includes powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to establish board control using cards like Wasteland and Engineered Explosives, while gaining card advantage through cards like Dark Confidant and Sensei's Divining Top. This control-oriented strategy allows the deck to dictate the pace of the game and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Survival of the Fittest card to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, enabling the player to easily bring out powerful creatures such as Vengevine. This deck is designed to be aggressive from the start, using aggro tactics to overwhelm opponents with early creature drops and utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Force of Will to maintain control of the game. The inclusion of key creatures like Tarmogoyf and Trygon Predator further adds to the aggressive nature of this deck.
